t: Lamentations 5
Remember,*p O Lord,*s what is come upon us: consider, and behold our reproach.
Our*p inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.
We*p are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows.
We*p have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold unto us.
Our*p necks are under persecution: we labour, and have no rest.
We*p have given the hand to the Egyptians, and to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
Our*p fathers have sinned, and are not; and we have borne their iniquities.
Servants*p have ruled over us: there is none that doth deliver us out of their hand.
We*p gat our bread with the peril of our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.
Our*p skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.
They*p ravished the women in Zion, and the maids in the cities of Judah.
Princes*p are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured.
They*p took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.
The*p elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their musick.
The*p joy of our heart is ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.
The*p crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, that we have sinned!
For*p this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.
Because*p of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.
Thou,*p O Lord,*s remainest for ever; thy throne from generation to generation.
Wherefore*p dost thou forget us for ever, and forsake us so long time?
Turn*p thou us unto thee, O Lord,*s and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.
But*p thou hast utterly rejected us; thou art very wroth against us.
